description: Lorlatinib is an orally available, small molecule multi-targeted kinase inhibitor that is FDA-approved for the treatment of adult patients with metastatic non-small cell lung cancer whose tumors are ALK-positive as detected by an FDA-approved test. There is promising clinical data in patients with ALK F1245Y-mutated neuroblastoma treated with the ALK tyrosine kinase inhibitor lorlatinib. In the Phase I New Approaches to Neuroblastoma Therapy (NANT) Consortium (NANT2015-02) trial of lorlatinib in pediatric, adolescent and adult patients with ALK-driven refractory or relapsed neuroblastoma, cohort A1 (≥12 months old to <18 years old; n=25) and cohort A2 (≥18 years old; n=15) were treated with lorlatinib monotherapy and cohort B2 (≥12 months old to <18 years old; n=9) were treated with combination lorlatinib plus chemotherapy (PMID: 37012551). Amongst patients harboring ALK F1245Y, cohort A1 (n=1, ALK F1245Y) achieved one complete response (PMID: 37012551).
